stepAnswer: At the 1% level of significance, the sample data do not show sufficient evidence that the percentage of first-time brides who are younger than their grooms is different from 50%.
stepTitle: Joon believes that 50% of first-time brides in the United States are younger than their grooms. She performs a hypothesis test to determine if the percentage is the same or different from 50%. Joon samples 100 first-time brides and 53 reply that they are younger than their grooms. For the hypothesis test, she uses a 1% level of significance.
choices: At the 1% level of significance, the sample data does show sufficient evidence that the percentage of first-time brides who are younger than their grooms is different from 50%.
At the 1% level of significance, the sample data do not show sufficient evidence that the percentage of first-time brides who are younger than their grooms is different from 50%.
At the 1% level of significance, the sample data do not show sufficient evidence that the percentage of first-time brides who are younger than their grooms is similar to 50%.
At the 1% level of significance, the sample data does show sufficient evidence that the percentage of first-time brides who are younger than their grooms is similar from 50%.
